sense.name: move like a ghost
sense.examples: Most saw a buck or two ghosting through the ground fog. By 2:40 p.m., I was ghosting cautiously over the tidal flats. The Wind is ghosting around the house tonight. He watched the dust ghosting down the curbless, potholed street. Blowing gently, he ghosted some dust over the beam, revealing it's location. Her scent ghosted through his nostrils. Flora came ghosting in, waiting for her turn. Benny and Spike ghosted along the side of the house, keeping to the shadows. The outline of a ship ghosted across the water. They ghosted Wind Dancer in under a single jib.

sense.name: haunt or pursue
sense.examples: Like pentimento, some old marks, some ruins, ghosting my days and nights. But his face kept ghosting up before my eyes. He was ghosted by all the memories. Fear of illness ghosts her.

sense.name: write for someone else
sense.examples: The Times ghosted the watered down "tell-all". No one has ghosted my autobiography yet. Peter Osborne ghosted the memoirs of a former Me 109 pilot. The man who ghosted the book was a famous romance writer.
